protocol_name: High quality DNA from Fusarium oxysporum conidia suitable for library preparation and long read sequencing with PacBio
protocol_name_html: High quality DNA from Fusarium oxysporum conidia suitable for library preparation and long read sequencing with PacBio
description: This protocol is for isolation of high quality, high molecular weight DNA (20 kb and larger) that is suitable for PacBio library preparation. This protocol has been tested on lyophilized conidia from multiple isolates of Fusarium oxysporum, including f. sp. apii, f. sp. ciceris, and f. sp. lycopersici.
before_start: Buffered Phenol Chloroform Isoamyl alcohol (P:C:I) ((25:24:1, saturated with 10 mM Tris, pH 8.0 and 1 mM EDTA) (Sigma P2069) [Note: use stocks that are less than 3 months old]
protocol_affiliation: Dept. of Plant Pathology, University of California, Davis, CA, 95616 USA

groups.group_name: MinION user group for high molecular weight DNA extraction from all kingdoms

authors: Sukhwinder Kaur, Quyen Anh Pham, and Lynn Epstein

authors_list.name: Sukhwinder Kaur
authors_list.affiliation: Dept. of Plant Pathology, University of California, Davis, CA, 95616 USA

authors_list.name: Quyen Anh Pham
authors_list.affiliation: Dept. of Plant Pathology, University of California, Davis, CA, 95616 USA

authors_list.name: and Lynn Epstein
authors_list.affiliation: Dept. of Plant Pathology, University of California, Davis, CA, 95616 USA

guidelines:
• When pipetting solutions with high molecular weight DNA, use low retention pipet tips with ca. 2 mm of the ends removed, i.e., wide-bore tips.
  • Use low DNA-binding microfuge tubes.

Mixing is critical for purification, but avoid vigorous vortexing (which shears DNA)

 

We thank Martijn Rep, Benjamin Schwessinger, and Oanh Nguyen for advice. This protocol is modified from protocols from Dr. Martijn Rep, University of Amsterdam, and Dr. Benjamin Schwessinger, Australian National University.

source_data.description: Sterilize all dry supplies by autoclaving.

components.data: Spread a Fusarium oxysporum conidial suspension onto 10 to 20, 100-mm-diam Petri dishes with potato dextrose agar.

components.data:
Use 1 ml of freshly prepared extraction buffer with RNase per 50 mg of lyophilized Fusarium oxysporum conidia.

Prepare fresh just before extraction.

For 5 ml extraction buffer first, add 4 ml Milli-Q nuclease-free water.

components.data: Cool a mortar (9 cm upper diam) with liquid N2.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cool a mortar (9 cm upper diam) with liquid N2.

components.data:
1. Notes: all steps are at RT. Prepare fresh 70% EtOH.
  2. Bring AMpure beads suspension to RT. Pipet out the beads slowly. Add 0.45X or 0.5X volume of the AMpure beads to the DNA.
  3. Mix the beads in the DNA solution thoroughly by flicking the tube. Do not vortex.
  4. Collect but do not pellet the beads at 7,000 g for 2 to 3 sec.
  5. Allow the DNA to bind to the beads by shaking at 200 rpm on a horizontal vortex mixer for 10 min.
  6. Incubate the tubes on a rotating wheel at 22 rpm for 20 min.
  7. Centrifuge tubes at 7000 g for 10 sec to pellet the beads.
  8. Place the tubes in a magnetic rack to hold the pellet on the side of the tube.
  9. Slowly pipette off the SN. As a precautionary measure, save the SN in a new tube, but only as a backup–your DNA should be bound to the beads. Avoid disturbing the bead pellet.
  10. With the beads in the magnetic rack, add 70% ethanol to the side of tube, i.e., avoid the pellet. Fill the 70% ethanol to the rim of the tube.
  11. Pipette off the ethanol and wash again with 70% ethanol as above. Remove all the ethanol without disturbing the bead pellet.
  12. Remove tubes from the magnetic rack and centrifuge briefly at 7000 g for 30 sec to collect the residual ethanol. Place tubes on the magnetic rack and remove the ethanol with a fine tip Pipette (P20 or P10).
  13. Check for any ethanol droplets. If present, repeat the previous step.
  14. Remove the tubes from the magnetic rack. Open the caps. Add the amount of EB for >100ng/ul DNA (by Qubit). Mix the EB and beads gently by flicking until the suspension is homogenous. Centrifuge the tubes briefly at 7000 g for 30 sec. Place the tubes in the magnetic rack and let the DNA elute off the beads for 5 to 10 minutes. When all the brown beads are on the side with the magnet, carefully and slowly remove the gDNA into a clean 1.5 ml microfuge tube. Do not pipet out any of the magnetic beads.
  15. Quantify DNA concentration and quality on Nanodrop and Qubit. For sufficient quality, with Nanodrop, the 260/280 ratio should be between 1.7 to 1.9 and the 260/230 ratio should be higher than 2.0.  The Qubit/Nanodrop concentration ratio should be > 0.7X.

Fragments should be size-selected with Blue Pippen before library preparation for PacBio.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1. Notes: all steps are at RT. Prepare fresh 70% EtOH.
  2. Bring AMpure beads suspension to RT. Pipet out the beads slowly. Add 0.45X or 0.5X volume of the AMpure beads to the DNA.
  3. Mix the beads in the DNA solution thoroughly by flicking the tube. Do not vortex.
  4. Collect but do not pellet the beads at 7,000 g for 2 to 3 sec.
  5. Allow the DNA to bind to the beads by shaking at 200 rpm on a horizontal vortex mixer for 10 min.
  6. Incubate the tubes on a rotating wheel at 22 rpm for 20 min.
  7. Centrifuge tubes at 7000 g for 10 sec to pellet the beads.
  8. Place the tubes in a magnetic rack to hold the pellet on the side of the tube.
  9. Slowly pipette off the SN. As a precautionary measure, save the SN in a new tube, but only as a backup–your DNA should be bound to the beads. Avoid disturbing the bead pellet.
  10. With the beads in the magnetic rack, add 70% ethanol to the side of tube, i.e., avoid the pellet. Fill the 70% ethanol to the rim of the tube.
  11. Pipette off the ethanol and wash again with 70% ethanol as above. Remove all the ethanol without disturbing the bead pellet.
  12. Remove tubes from the magnetic rack and centrifuge briefly at 7000 g for 30 sec to collect the residual ethanol. Place tubes on the magnetic rack and remove the ethanol with a fine tip Pipette (P20 or P10).
  13. Check for any ethanol droplets. If present, repeat the previous step.
  14. Remove the tubes from the magnetic rack. Open the caps. Add the amount of EB for >100ng/ul DNA (by Qubit). Mix the EB and beads gently by flicking until the suspension is homogenous. Centrifuge the tubes briefly at 7000 g for 30 sec. Place the tubes in the magnetic rack and let the DNA elute off the beads for 5 to 10 minutes. When all the brown beads are on the side with the magnet, carefully and slowly remove the gDNA into a clean 1.5 ml microfuge tube. Do not pipet out any of the magnetic beads.
  15. Quantify DNA concentration and quality on Nanodrop and Qubit. For sufficient quality, with Nanodrop, the 260/280 ratio should be between 1.7 to 1.9 and the 260/230 ratio should be higher than 2.0.  The Qubit/Nanodrop concentration ratio should be > 0.7X.

Fragments should be size-selected with Blue Pippen before library preparation for PacBio.

source_data.description: After the N2 evaporates, add 250 mg sand.

components.data: Add additional liquid N2 to cool the sand.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add additional liquid N2 to cool the sand.
Then add 50 mg lyophilized conidia.
Add 20 to 25 ml liquid N2. (1/3)

components.data: Grind quickly with force for 15 to 20 sec. (1/3)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Grind quickly with force for 15 to 20 sec. (1/3)
Then add more liquid N2. (2/3)
Grind again.  (2/3)
Add more liquid N2. (3/3)
Grind again. (3/3)

components.data: Transfer the ground conidia and sand mixture to a 2 ml microfuge tube (T#1) containing 1 ml of extraction buffer with RNase A.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the ground conidia and sand mixture to a 2 ml microfuge tube (T#1) containing 1 ml of extraction buffer with RNase A.

source_data.annotation: To optimize your grinding procedure, examine ground lyophilized conidia microscopically (Fig. 1); you need to grind sufficiently so that most of the conidia are cracked open. Any more grinding than that only shears the DNA.]
source_data.thread_text: To optimize your grinding procedure, examine ground lyophilized conidia microscopically (Fig. 1); you need to grind sufficiently so that most of the conidia are cracked open. Any more grinding than that only shears the DNA.]

source_data.annotation: We typically prepare 4 tubes, each with 50 mg lyophilized conidia per preparation. The tubes are pooled at the end of the preparation.
source_data.thread_text: We typically prepare 4 tubes, each with 50 mg lyophilized conidia per preparation. The tubes are pooled at the end of the preparation.
source_data.body: We typically prepare 4 tubes, each with 50 mg lyophilized conidia per preparation. The tubes are pooled at the end of the preparation.

components.data: Label 3 additional tubes (T#2, T#3, & T#4) per 50 mg conidia.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Label 3 additional tubes (T#2, T#3, & T#4) per 50 mg conidia.

components.data: Mix the T#1 tube from step 31 on a horizontal low speed (200 rpm) vortex mixer for 2 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix the T#1 tube from step 31 on a horizontal low speed (200 rpm) vortex mixer for 2 min.

components.data: Incubate at room temperature (RT) for 30 min, with mixing by inverting tubes every 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at room temperature (RT) for 30 min, with mixing by inverting tubes every 5 min.

components.data: Add 6 µl (120 µg) of proteinase K to T#1.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 6 µl (120 µg) of proteinase K to T#1.

components.data: Mix well on the low speed horizontal vortex mixer for 20 min at RT.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix well on the low speed horizontal vortex mixer for 20 min at RT.

components.data: Cool tubes on ice for 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cool tubes on ice for 5 min.

components.data: Add an equal volume of ice-cold, buffered P:C:I (25:24:1)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add an equal volume of ice-cold, buffered P:C:I (25:24:1)

components.data: Mix on the horizontal vortex mixer for 15 sec.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix on the horizontal vortex mixer for 15 sec.

components.data: Transfer supernatant (SN) to a new 2 ml microfuge tube (T#2).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer supernatant (SN) to a new 2 ml microfuge tube (T#2).

components.data: Add an equal volume of ice-cold, buffered P:C:I.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add an equal volume of ice-cold, buffered P:C:I.

components.data: Mix on the horizontal vortex mixer for 2 min at 4ºC.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix on the horizontal vortex mixer for 2 min at 4ºC.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 43 of High quality DNA from Fusarium oxysporum conidia suitable for library preparation and long read sequencing with PacBio
source_data.protocol_name: High quality DNA from Fusarium oxysporum conidia suitable for library preparation and long read sequencing with PacBio
source_data.protocol_name_html: High quality DNA from Fusarium oxysporum conidia suitable for library preparation and long read sequencing with PacBio
source_data.annotation: Always avoid transferring any of the interfaces.
source_data.thread_text: Always avoid transferring any of the interfaces.
source_data.body: Always avoid transferring any of the interfaces.

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 15000g for 10 min at 4ºC.

components.data: Transfer SN (Vol = 800 to 900µl) to a new 2 ml tube (T#3).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer SN (Vol = 800 to 900µl) to a new 2 ml tube (T#3).

components.data: Add an equal volume of ice-cold chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (C:I) (24:1).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add an equal volume of ice-cold chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (C:I) (24:1).

components.data: Mix on the horizontal vortex mixer for 15 sec at 4ºC.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix on the horizontal vortex mixer for 15 sec at 4ºC.
Centrifuge at 15000g for 5 min at 4°C.

components.data: Very carefully, remove the SN without disturbing the interface to a new 2 ml tube (T#4).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Very carefully, remove the SN without disturbing the interface to a new 2 ml tube (T#4).

components.data: Add 0.1 volume of ice-cold 4M NaCl to T#4 and mix by inverting the tube several times. DNA strings should be visible.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 0.1 volume of ice-cold 4M NaCl to T#4 and mix by inverting the tube several times. DNA strings should be visible.

components.data: Add 1 volume of ice-cold isopropyl alcohol (IPA).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1 volume of ice-cold isopropyl alcohol (IPA).

components.data: Mix well by inverting tubes gently at least 20 times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix well by inverting tubes gently at least 20 times.
Centrifuge at 10,000g for 30 min at 4ºC.
Centrifuge at 15000g for 6 min at 4ºC.

source_data.body: The buffer is on top. Only use the lower PCI, here and in the subsequent step.

source_data.description: Incubate on ice for 10 min.
Centrifuge for 1 min at 13000g at RT.

components.data: Perform an AMpure bead cleanup using either a 0.45X or 0.5X volume of beads as indicated below.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform an AMpure bead cleanup using either a 0.45X or 0.5X volume of beads as indicated below.
Repeat Nanodrop and Qubit determinations.

Open the caps.

components.data: Add the amount of EB for >100ng/µl DNA (by Qubit).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the amount of EB for >100ng/µl DNA (by Qubit).

components.data: Mix the EB and beads gently by flicking until the suspension is homogenous.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix the EB and beads gently by flicking until the suspension is homogenous.

components.data: Centrifuge the tubes briefly at 7000 g for 30 sec.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the tubes briefly at 7000 g for 30 sec.

components.data: Place the tubes in the magnetic rack and let the DNA elute off the beads for 5 to 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tubes in the magnetic rack and let the DNA elute off the beads for 5 to 10 minutes.

components.data: When all the brown beads are on the side with the magnet, carefully and slowly remove the gDNA into a clean 1.5 ml microfuge tube. Do not pipet out any of the magnetic beads.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When all the brown beads are on the side with the magnet, carefully and slowly remove the gDNA into a clean 1.5 ml microfuge tube. Do not pipet out any of the magnetic beads.
Prepare fresh 70% EtOH.

components.data:
Prepare Buffer -5X RNB

1M Tris-HCl pH 8.0

1.25 M NaCl

0.25 M EDTA

Autoclave and store at 4ºC
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

components.data: DNA extraction buffer for approx. 250 mg of lyophilized conidia.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: DNA extraction buffer for approx. 250 mg of lyophilized conidia.
